logline: In a clockwork universe powered by air, a scientist performs a dissection on his own brain, only to discover that the slowing of time is a symptom of their world's inevitable demise, prompting a final meditation on the nature of consciousness and existence.
title: Exhalation
characters: ANAXIM: A scientist-anatomist from a race of mechanical beings. Analytical, precise, and driven by an insatiable curiosity. His calm, methodical exterior masks a profound philosophical depth and a quiet courage in the face of existential truths.

episodes.raw_narrative: Ибо заправочная станция — это в первую очередь место, куда люди собираются ради светских бесед, место, где мы получаем эмоциональную зарядку наряду с физической. У всех у нас дома припасены запасные наборы заряженных лёгких, однако в одиночестве процесс открывания грудной клетки и замены лёгких представляется немногим веселее, нежели уборка по дому. В компании же этот процесс превращается в совместную деятельность, коллективное развлечение.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. FILLING STATION - DAY

SOUND of gentle hissing, metallic clicks, and low hum of conversation

A vast, sunlit chamber with polished aluminum walls. Dozens of MECHANICAL BEINGS, their bodies a mix of titanium and brass, mingle. 

One being, a LIBRARIAN, unlatches a plate on their chest. A soft PNEUMATIC hiss. They remove two spent, dull aluminum cylinders—their LUNGS.

A FRIEND offers them a freshly charged pair, gleaming and vibrating faintly. The Librarian slots them in. Their movements become instantly more fluid, their optical lenses brighter.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
For most of history, the notion that we draw life from air was too obvious to state. But a filling station is more than a source of life. It’s where we find it.

CLOSE ON Anaxim, watching the exchange. He nods subtly, a small, analytical smile on his metallic face.

episodes.raw_narrative: В соответствии с традицией ровно в полдень первого дня нового года глашатай декламирует стихотворный текст, оду, сочиненную давным-давно специально для данного ежегодного торжества, чтение которой занимает ровно один час. Глашатай упомянул, что на его последнем выступлении башенные куранты пробили час дня прежде, чем он закончил чтение, чего не случалось никогда ранее.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
EXT. TOWN SQUARE - DAY

An enormous pendulum clock tower dominates a square filled with mechanical citizens. A TOWN CRIER, ornate and official, stands on a podium, reciting from an engraved metal sheet.

His voice is rhythmic, powered by the air from his lungs.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
It began, as great changes often do, with a small anomaly. An observation so trivial it was almost dismissed.

The Crier continues his hour-long recitation. He’s nearing the end. 

Suddenly, the CLOCK TOWER chimes. A deep, resonant BONG. It strikes the hour.

The Crier stops, looking up at the clock face, perplexed. He still has several lines left on his sheet. A murmur ripples through the crowd. Anaxim, in the crowd, looks from the Crier to the clock, his brow-plates furrowing in thought.

episodes.raw_narrative: На лекции по анатомии, которую я посетил ровно сто лет назад, лектор продемонстрировал отрубленную руку, с которой была снята внешняя оболочка, чтобы обнажить плотный ряд стержней и поршней. Я отлично помню, как он, подсоединив артериальные шланги руки к вмонтированному в стену лабораторному лёгкому, начал манипулировать приводными стержнями, торчащими из рваного основания конечности, заставляя ладонь судорожно сжиматься и разжиматься.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANATOMY LECTURE HALL - DAY (FLASHBACK)

Dust motes dance in shafts of light. A younger ANAXIM sits among STUDENTS. On a table, a disembodied mechanical ARM rests, its outer casing removed to show a dense array of pistons and rods.

A PROFESSOR connects hoses from the arm to a wall-mounted lung. HISS of compressed air.

With a probe, the Professor touches actuators at the arm's severed base. The metal fingers CLENCH violently, then release. A dead, mechanical spasm.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
Death, thankfully, is rare. But this makes the study of our own bodies a challenge. For years, we only understood ourselves in pieces.

CLOSE ON Young Anaxim's face. Not revulsion, but intense, analytical curiosity.

episodes.raw_narrative: Я выступил с видоизмененной версией запомнившейся мне лекции, на которой я снял кожух с собственной руки и обратил внимание студентов на стержни, которые сокращались и расширялись в ответ на шевеление пальцев.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANATOMY LECTURE HALL - DAY (PRESENT)

Anaxim now stands where the Professor once did. He has removed the casing from his own left forearm. He flexes his fingers.

CLOSE ON his arm. We see the intricate dance of polished rods and pistons contracting and expanding in perfect synchrony. It is fluid, alive.

ANAXIM
(to his students)
...the difference between a dead mechanism and a living one is not the design, but the intent. The pattern. The flow.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
But for all our progress, one great mystery remained. The seat of that intent. The mechanism of memory.

episodes.raw_narrative: Многие десятилетия превалировала теория памяти, в которой утверждалось, что весь личный опыт индивидуума выгравирован на станицах из золотой фольги... Я отвергал эту гипотезу... если весь наш жизненный опыт и правда записывался на фольге, тогда почему наши воспоминания были неполные?
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT

SOUND of quiet ticking and whirring

Anaxim peers into a microscope. On a slide are tiny, shimmering flakes of gold foil, recovered from an accident site.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
The prevailing theory was that memory was recorded. Etched onto golden leaves within the brain.

He adjusts the focus. The flakes are just... flakes. Scratched, meaningless.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
But if our lives were a recording, why is it so incomplete? Why do we forget?

He pulls back from the microscope, frustrated. He looks at his own reflection in the polished chrome surface of a tool, contemplating the machine that is himself.

episodes.raw_narrative: Известие прибыло из дальнего округа. Тамошний муниципальный глашатай тоже заметил, что башенные куранты пробили час дня раньше, чем он закончил новогоднюю декламацию. Примечательной же эту новость делал тот факт, что тамошние часы использовали принципиально иной принцип отсчета времени: при помощи потока ртути в чашу.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. FILLING STATION - DAY

Anaxim is swapping his lungs. A TRAVELER, his chassis dusty from a long journey, is speaking animatedly to a small group.

TRAVELER
...and their crier said the same thing! But their clock isn't a pendulum. It's a mercury-flow chronometer.

Anaxim freezes, a fresh lung halfway into his chest. His optical lenses widen. Pendulums can have flaws. But a completely different mechanism... showing the same anomaly?

ANAXIM (V.O.)
It couldn't be a shared mechanical flaw. It was something else. Something universal. My suspicion was... darker.

He slams the chest plate shut with a decisive CLANG. He has a new purpose.

episodes.raw_narrative: Первый прибор, который я изготовил в своей лаборатории, был предельно прост: я зафиксировал в монтажных кронштейнах четыре призмы и расположил их в пространстве так, чтобы их вершины заняли углы воображаемого прямоугольника... когда я садился так, чтобы мои глаза оказывались на уровне нижней призмы, я получал ясную проекцию своего затылка.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT

MONTAGE—

Anaxim works with feverish precision.

- He grinds lenses, mounts them into brass fittings.
- He assembles four prisms onto a complex rig behind a chair.
- He sits in the chair, adjusts the final prism. He looks forward. In the prism before him is a perfect, clear image of the back of his own head.

He has built a solipsistic periscope.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
I could not ask another to be the subject of such a risky exploration. And I needed to perform the dissection myself. Auto-dissection was the only solution.

He stares at his own reflection, his resolve hardening.

episodes.raw_narrative: К исполнительным стержням я прикрепил блок прецизионных манипуляторов... манипуляторы позволяли оператору выполнять любую задачу, которую он мог выполнить своими руками, но на гораздо меньшем масштабе.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT

Anaxim attaches a set of incredibly fine, spider-like manipulators to the end of a complex system of control rods. The rig is positioned behind the operating chair, aimed at where his head will be.

He sits at a control console across the room. He places his hands on two control pads.

He watches the periscope's view on a screen. The tiny manipulators behind the chair mimic his hand movements perfectly. He makes them pick up a single grain of dust from the chair's headrest.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
My hands and eyes, displaced. Ready to operate on a subject I could not see, except through a reflection of a reflection.

episodes.raw_narrative: Я принес дюжину заправленных лёгких и соединил их трубопроводом... Это должно обеспечить меня воздухом на протяжении шести дней.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT

Anaxim arranges twelve gleaming, fully-charged lungs in a rack under his operating desk. He connects them with a manifold of copper pipes and hoses.

A single tube runs from the manifold to the chair, ending in a bronchial nozzle.

He checks each connection, his movements deliberate. He is preparing for a long dive into the unknown.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
I planned for six days of air. If I was not finished by then, a colleague would come. But I knew there was only one reason I wouldn't finish on time.

He looks at the scalpels on the manipulator rig. The gleam of polished steel.

episodes.raw_narrative: Сначала я удалил сильноизогнутую пластину, которая закрывала заднюю и верхнюю части моей головы. Затем снял две менее изогнутые пластины, закрывавшие голову по бокам.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT

SOUND of a high-speed micro-drill, then a soft metallic pop

Anaxim is strapped into the chair. His gaze is fixed on the periscope's view.

His hands are on the controls. Behind him, the manipulators work.

A tiny, diamond-tipped saw cuts along the seams of his own cranium. With surgical precision, a manipulator lifts the top plate of his skull away.

Another manipulator removes the side plates.

Through the periscope, we see it: his brain. A breathtakingly complex assembly of gold, brass, and platinum clockwork, whirring and clicking softly. It is a universe in miniature.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
It was the most beautiful and complex device I had ever seen. Undeniably... divine.

episodes.raw_narrative: Повторив эту процедуру по всему периметру блока, я удлинил все его соединения с остальной частью мозга. Теперь я мог открепить блок от несущей рамы и вытащить компонент за пределы того, что когда-то было задней частью моей головы.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT

CLOSE UP on the periscope view. Anaxim's manipulators are working deep within the exposed brain.

He carefully disconnects a pneumatic hose from a memory block. A wisp of air escapes. He quickly attaches a longer hose, rerouting the airflow without interrupting the component's function.

He repeats this process dozens of times, replacing every connection to one block with longer tethers.

Finally, he unlatches the block from its frame. He gently pulls it out, away from the central mass. It hangs in space, connected only by a web of new hoses.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
I had to perform a simple calculation to ensure my reasoning was not impaired. It was not. The first piece was successfully displaced.

episodes.raw_narrative: Когда я закончил, мой мозг выглядел как стоп-кадр взрыва через мгновение после детонации, и снова я испытал головокружение, думая об этом.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT

TIME LAPSE. The process is repeated again and again.

Six memory blocks are now pulled away from the central processor, suspended in the air around Anaxim's head on a scaffolding of clamps and hoses. 

His brain is an exploded diagram of itself. A deconstructed consciousness.

Through the periscope, we see the now-exposed core: the thinking engine. It pulses with a faster, more complex rhythm than the memory blocks.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
I had become an inverted being. My body, fragmented. My brain, surrounding me. In this configuration, I began my exploration.

episodes.raw_narrative: Как я и предсказывал, пачек фольги там не оказалось... Вместо этого блок, казалось, представлял собой банк воздушных трубочек... Под действием струек воздуха, вырывающихся из капилляров, листочки удерживались в различных положениях.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT

The periscope's microscope lens zooms in on one of the suspended memory blocks.

EXTREME CLOSE UP: No foil. No gears. Instead, a dense lattice of gold wires. And woven through them, millions of tiny, leaf-like gold flakes.

Microscopic jets of air from unseen capillaries push against the leaves, holding them in specific patterns. The patterns are stable, fixed. A steady, silent wind of information.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
Not recorded, but sustained. Memory was not an etching. It was a standing wave. A persistent pattern of airflow.

episodes.raw_narrative: Вместо этого листочки трепетали, и настолько быстро, что были едва различимы... Решётка была не столько машиной, сколько страницей, на которой машина была написана и на которой сама машина непрерывно писала.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT

Anaxim directs the microscope to the central thinking engine.

EXTREME CLOSE UP: The same lattice structure, but here the golden leaves are not still. They flutter and shimmer with incredible speed, a constant, chaotic, beautiful storm.

They form and dissolve temporary channels, directing airflow to other leaves in a cascade of logic that is constantly rewriting itself.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
Here, the air was not a force acting upon the machine. The air *was* the machine. We are not the clockwork. We are the wind that flows through it.

episodes.raw_narrative: Это не башенные часы бежали вперед. Это наши мысли замедлились... давление окружающей атмосферы возрастало.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT

Anaxim stares, mesmerized, at the fluttering leaves of his own consciousness. He notices something. A subtle slowness. A fraction less intensity in the storm.

His gaze darts from the image of his brain to a pressure gauge on the wall. It reads slightly higher than baseline.

FLASH CUTS:
- The Town Crier looking at the clock tower.
- The mercury-flow chronometer, dripping steadily.
- The fluttering leaves in his brain, just a hair too slow.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
And then, the cascade of insight. The clocks weren't fast. We were slow. The pressure differential that powered our thoughts... was diminishing. The air outside was growing thicker.

episodes.raw_narrative: Где-то высоко, за пределами видимости, стены из хрома, окружающие мир, смыкаются в форме купола. Наша вселенная, скорее всего, представляет собой герметичную камеру, а не открытый колодец.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
EXT. EDGE OF THE WORLD - DAY (IMAGINED)

Anaxim stands at the edge of his world. A monolithic, perfectly smooth chrome wall rises from the ground, stretching up into the sky.

CAMERA PANS UP, following the wall. Up, up, past the clouds, until it begins to CURVE inward. Our world is a snow globe. A sealed pressure vessel.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
Our universe is not infinite. It is a sealed chamber. And every breath, every movement, every thought, releases air from the great reservoir below... into the chamber we inhabit.

episodes.raw_narrative: Когда давление станет одинаковым повсюду во вселенной, всякое движение воздуха прекратится. Однажды нас окружит неподвижный воздух, и мы не сможем извлечь из него никакой пользы... Вселенная достигнет совершенного равновесия.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT

Anaxim's hands tremble on the controls. On the screen, the golden leaves of his mind flutter faster as his panic rises.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
Life is not air. Life is a difference in pressure. A gradient. And all gradients seek equilibrium. It is the final law. When the pressure within equals the pressure without... everything will stop.

He watches his own agitated thoughts, realizing that his very panic is hastening the end. He forces himself to calm down. The fluttering slows. He closes his physical eyes. He has seen enough.

episodes.raw_narrative: Как только правда стала достоянием масс и люди впервые в жизни задумались о неизбежности смерти, мир охватила паника. Многие призывали к значительному сокращению активности в расчете на замедление процесса уплотнения атмосферы.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
EXT. TOWN SQUARE - DAY

MONTAGE of societal collapse.

- Beings sit perfectly still, trying not to 'spend' air.
- Fights break out at filling stations over accusations of wastefulness.
- A 'Reversalist' machine, a massive compressor, is unveiled. It sputters, consuming more air than it produces, and fails spectacularly.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
Panic. Then denial. Then the futile search for a way to reverse the flow. But you cannot win a fight against entropy.

Anaxim watches the chaos from a distance, his expression one of profound sadness.

episodes.raw_narrative: В какой-то момент наши члены перестанут двигаться вообще. Я не могу быть уверен в точной последовательности событий в самом конце, но рисую себе сценарий, согласно которому наш мыслительный процесс будет продолжаться еще какое-то время, так что мы будем оставаться в сознании, но неподвижные, как статуи.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT (FUTURE VISION)

The laboratory is still. Anaxim sits at his desk, motionless as a statue. His optical lenses are lit, but his body does not move.

Outside the window, the entire city is frozen. A world of thinking statues, their limbs locked as the pressure gradient becomes too weak to move them.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
Our bodies will fail first. We will become prisoners in our own shells, our minds still turning, until the last whisper of pressure is gone.

episodes.raw_narrative: Именно поэтому я написал отчет. Надеюсь, что вы один из исследователей. Вы нашли эти медные страницы и расшифровали слова, выгравированные на поверхности... в результате чтения моих слов воздушные узоры, формирующие ваши мысли, становятся похожими на те узоры, которые однажды формировали мои мысли. И таким образом благодаря вам я оживаю.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
INT. ANAXIM'S LABORATORY - NIGHT

Anaxim is no longer operating on himself. He is seated at his desk, using a fine stylus to engrave words onto thin sheets of copper.

SOUND of stylus scratching on metal.

He works slowly, deliberately. Each word is a permanent mark. A message in a bottle.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
I am not this air. I am the pattern it currently holds. A pattern that will be lost. But if you are reading this, perhaps that pattern can be... approximated. In you. And for a moment, I may live again.

He looks up from his work, out the window at the chrome world, a sense of peace on his features.

episodes.raw_narrative: Созерцайте чудо, которым является все сущее во вселенной, и радуйтесь, что способны это делать. Я чувствую, что имею право сказать вам это, потому что, вырезая эти слова, я делаю то же самое.
episodes.screenplay_instructions:
EXT. EMPTY CITY - ETERNAL DUSK

The world is still. The great clock tower is silent. The filling stations are empty. Mechanical beings stand frozen in the streets, in their homes, in lecture halls.

CAMERA DRIFTS through the silent city, a ghost observing a lost world.

It comes to rest in Anaxim's laboratory. He is frozen at his desk, stylus poised over the final word on a copper sheet.

ANAXIM (V.O.)
Contemplate the marvel that is existence, and rejoice that you are able to do so. I feel I have the right to tell you this. Because as I engrave these words, I am doing the same.

FADE TO BLACK.

nitpicker_report:
1. WHAT THE FUCK? (Logic/Data)
  - Quote: Anaxim performs a complex, hours-long neurosurgery on himself while conscious.
  - Complaint: How is this possible without him passing out from the shock, making a mistake from pain, or his own thoughts interfering with the delicate motor control required?
  - Solution: The screenplay establishes that his species is entirely mechanical. Pain is a data input, not an overwhelming biological response. Consciousness is a process of airflow, physically separate from the actuators controlling his limbs. The use of a remote manipulation rig, controlled from a console, provides the necessary layer of abstraction. The process is more like a master watchmaker repairing himself than a surgeon operating on flesh.

2. WHY THE FUCK? (Purpose)
  - Quote: The extended, multi-episode sequence of the self-dissection.
  - Complaint: Does this sequence drag? Is its complexity justified, or could the discovery be made more simply?
  - Solution: The scene's length and detail are essential. It's the central metaphor of the story: the ultimate act of introspection. It visually demonstrates Anaxim's defining characteristics (precision, courage, curiosity) and makes the final discovery feel earned, not just stumbled upon. Simplifying it would rob the story of its philosophical weight and transform a profound act of self-discovery into a simple plot point.

3. ON WHAT GROUNDS? (Contract/Boundaries)
  - Quote: The Reversalists' machine fails because it consumes more energy than it produces.
  - Complaint: This feels like a convenient plot device to enforce the story's bleak outcome.
  - Solution: This is not a plot device, but a direct application of the story's core physical law, analogous to the Second Law of Thermodynamics. The universe's 'energy' is the pressure differential. Any machine operating within that system must use that differential to function, thus contributing to the overall equilibrium. The screenplay includes a scene explicitly showing the machine's failure to reinforce this unbreakable rule of the setting.

4. FUCK THAT (Realism/Errors)
  - Quote: Anaxim immediately intuits the grand cosmological implications of his discovery.
  - Complaint: His leap from 'my thoughts are slow' to 'the universe is a sealed dome reaching equilibrium' is too fast and feels like a deus ex machina of intellect.
  - Solution: The screenplay breaks this realization into stages. First, he observes the slowness in the golden leaves. He connects this to the clock anomalies. His initial hypothesis, shown in his V.O., is a mechanical fault within his own brain. Only after ruling that out does he consider an external factor—ambient pressure. The final leap to the 'sealed dome' cosmology is presented as a horrifying but logical conclusion based on his prior knowledge (having seen the chrome wall at the world's edge). This adds a process of elimination and makes the discovery feel more like scientific deduction than a sudden miracle.
shit_redo_report: The initial draft was a very literal adaptation, essentially Anaxim's monologue read over abstract visuals of clockwork. It was informative but cinematically inert (the 'shit' draft). The second pass focused on breaking the monologue into distinct scenes: showing the filling station, the town crier, the lab. This was better, but still felt like a narrated slideshow. The final, polished version (the 'bulletproof' version delivered) focused on the 'Show, Don't Tell' principle. Instead of just hearing about the old anatomy lecture, we see it in a flashback. Instead of hearing about the social panic, we see a montage of it. Sound design was layered in—the hiss of air, the clicks of machinery, the resonant bong of the clock tower—to build the world's texture. Anaxim's non-verbal cues were added to show his internal state: the furrowing of his brow-plates, the decisive clang as he closes his chest, the final peace on his face. This transformed the text from a philosophical treatise into a tangible, visual story.
